class.name: Spatial
class.brief_description: Most basic 3D game object, parent of all 3D-related nodes.
class.description: Most basic 3D game object, with a 3D [Transform] and visibility settings. All other 3D game objects inherit from Spatial. Use [Spatial] as a parent node to move, scale, rotate and show/hide children in a 3D project. Affine operations (rotate, scale, translate) happen in parent's local coordinate system, unless the [Spatial] object is set as top-level. Affine operations in this coordinate system correspond to direct affine operations on the [Spatial]'s transform. The word local below refers to this coordinate system. The coordinate system that is attached to the [Spatial] object itself is referred to as object-local coordinate system. [b]Note:[/b] Unless otherwise specified, all methods that have angle parameters must have angles specified as [i]radians[/i]. To convert degrees to radians, use [method @GDScript.deg2rad].

method.name: force_update_transform
method.description: Forces the transform to update. Transform changes in physics are not instant for performance reasons. Transforms are accumulated and then set. Use this if you need an up-to-date transform when doing physics operations.

method.name: get_parent_spatial
method.description: Returns the parent [Spatial], or an empty [Object] if no parent exists or parent is not of type [Spatial].

method.name: get_world
method.description: Returns the current [World] resource this [Spatial] node is registered to.

method.name: global_rotate
method.description: Rotates the global (world) transformation around axis, a unit [Vector3], by specified angle in radians. The rotation axis is in global coordinate system.

method.name: global_scale
method.description: Scales the global (world) transformation by the given [Vector3] scale factors.

method.name: global_translate
method.description: Moves the global (world) transformation by [Vector3] offset. The offset is in global coordinate system.

method.name: hide
method.description: Disables rendering of this node. Changes [member visible] to [code]false[/code].

method.name: is_local_transform_notification_enabled
method.description: Returns whether node notifies about its local transformation changes. [Spatial] will not propagate this by default.

method.name: is_scale_disabled
method.description: Returns whether this node uses a scale of [code](1, 1, 1)[/code] or its local transformation scale.

method.name: is_set_as_toplevel
method.description: Returns whether this node is set as Toplevel, that is whether it ignores its parent nodes transformations.

method.name: is_transform_notification_enabled
method.description: Returns whether the node notifies about its global and local transformation changes. [Spatial] will not propagate this by default.

method.name: is_visible_in_tree
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the node is present in the [SceneTree], its [member visible] property is [code]true[/code] and all its antecedents are also visible. If any antecedent is hidden, this node will not be visible in the scene tree.

method.name: look_at
method.description: Rotates itself so that the local -Z axis points towards the [code]target[/code] position. The transform will first be rotated around the given [code]up[/code] vector, and then fully aligned to the target by a further rotation around an axis perpendicular to both the [code]target[/code] and [code]up[/code] vectors. Operations take place in global space.

method.name: look_at_from_position
method.description: Moves the node to the specified [code]position[/code], and then rotates itself to point toward the [code]target[/code] as per [method look_at]. Operations take place in global space.

method.name: orthonormalize
method.description: Resets this node's transformations (like scale, skew and taper) preserving its rotation and translation by performing Gram-Schmidt orthonormalization on this node's [Transform].

method.name: rotate
method.description: Rotates the local transformation around axis, a unit [Vector3], by specified angle in radians.

method.name: rotate_object_local
method.description: Rotates the local transformation around axis, a unit [Vector3], by specified angle in radians. The rotation axis is in object-local coordinate system.

method.name: rotate_x
method.description: Rotates the local transformation around the X axis by angle in radians.

method.name: rotate_y
method.description: Rotates the local transformation around the Y axis by angle in radians.

method.name: rotate_z
method.description: Rotates the local transformation around the Z axis by angle in radians.

method.name: scale_object_local
method.description: Scales the local transformation by given 3D scale factors in object-local coordinate system.

method.name: set_as_toplevel
method.description: Makes the node ignore its parents transformations. Node transformations are only in global space.

method.name: set_disable_scale
method.description: Sets whether the node uses a scale of [code](1, 1, 1)[/code] or its local transformation scale. Changes to the local transformation scale are preserved.

method.name: set_identity
method.description: Reset all transformations for this node (sets its [Transform] to the identity matrix).

method.name: set_ignore_transform_notification
method.description: Sets whether the node ignores notification that its transformation (global or local) changed.

method.name: set_notify_local_transform
method.description: Sets whether the node notifies about its local transformation changes. [Spatial] will not propagate this by default.

method.name: set_notify_transform
method.description: Sets whether the node notifies about its global and local transformation changes. [Spatial] will not propagate this by default, unless it is in the editor context and it has a valid gizmo.

method.name: show
method.description: Enables rendering of this node. Changes [member visible] to [code]true[/code].

method.name: to_global
method.description: Transforms [code]local_point[/code] from this node's local space to world space.

method.name: to_local
method.description: Transforms [code]global_point[/code] from world space to this node's local space.

method.name: translate
method.description: Changes the node's position by the given offset [Vector3]. Note that the translation [code]offset[/code] is affected by the node's scale, so if scaled by e.g. [code](10, 1, 1)[/code], a translation by an offset of [code](2, 0, 0)[/code] would actually add 20 ([code]2 * 10[/code]) to the X coordinate.

method.name: translate_object_local
method.description: Changes the node's position by the given offset [Vector3] in local space.

method.name: update_gizmo
method.description: Updates the [SpatialGizmo] of this node.

members.member: The [SpatialGizmo] for this node. Used for example in [EditorSpatialGizmo] as custom visualization and editing handles in Editor.

Rotation part of the local transformation in radians, specified in terms of YXZ-Euler angles in the format (X angle, Y angle, Z angle). [b]Note:[/b] In the mathematical sense, rotation is a matrix and not a vector. The three Euler angles, which are the three independent parameters of the Euler-angle parametrization of the rotation matrix, are stored in a [Vector3] data structure not because the rotation is a vector, but only because [Vector3] exists as a convenient data-structure to store 3 floating-point numbers. Therefore, applying affine operations on the rotation "vector" is not meaningful.
Rotation part of the local transformation in degrees, specified in terms of YXZ-Euler angles in the format (X angle, Y angle, Z angle).
Scale part of the local transformation.
Local space [Transform] of this node, with respect to the parent node.
If [code]true[/code], this node is drawn. The node is only visible if all of its antecedents are visible as well (in other words, [method is_visible_in_tree] must return [code]true[/code]).

constants.constant: Spatial nodes receives this notification when their global transform changes. This means that either the current or a parent node changed its transform. In order for [constant NOTIFICATION_TRANSFORM_CHANGED] to work, users first need to ask for it, with [method set_notify_transform]. The notification is also sent if the node is in the editor context and it has a valid gizmo.
Spatial nodes receives this notification when they are registered to new [World] resource.
Spatial nodes receives this notification when they are unregistered from current [World] resource.
Spatial nodes receives this notification when their visibility changes.
